p: Molecular dynamic simulations were performed to gain an understanding of the underlying mechanisms leading to the overall higher preponderance of D30N in subtype B relative to other subtypes. D30N appears to selectively confer resistance to NFV in subtype B by increasing the flexibility of the protease (PR) flap region and destabilizing the PR-inhibitor complex [ 60]. For subtype C, D30N required the accessory N83T mutation to confer resistance and rescue fitness [ 61].
